medical_history.chief_complaint: Primary amenorrhea and delayed bone maturation in three family members.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began in early adolescence with no onset of puberty; duration has been extended until early adulthood. The affected siblings were noted to have no breast development and primary amenorrhea, with progressive evaluation revealing delayed bone maturation.
medical_history.past_medical_history: A homozygous ESR1 mutation was identified in two sisters and one brother, all from a consanguineous family, leading to estrogen insensitivity without entering puberty.
medical_history.family_history: The parents are healthy first cousins. The mother had normal menarche at age 15, and the father entered puberty at 15. One unaffected sister experienced normal puberty.
